Review from Raven D.
5 friends 14 reviews
Raven D.
San Francisco, CA 6/24/2012 I have actually woken up with my hand in a now-soggy bag and pesto mayo all over my face after having stopped in to Acme after a few drinks. More than once. One of the top 3 burgers you will find in SF proper in my opinion. You can get sizable Buffalo, Lamb and Ostrich burgers and the traditional beef, but you pay. But like the $5 shake in "Pulp Fiction" I dare you to take a bite and not shout "Goddamn, that's a pretty f*ckin' good burger." Oh and the bacon is thick cut and lovely. The fixins bar is also a plus as I really hate being policed in the fixins/condiments department. I think I should be allowed to have 87 pickles on my burger if I want. Why? Cuz I'm an adult.

Melissa N.
San Francisco, CA 6/20/2012 *On our quest to try 52 new places in 52 weeks.*
I know- you think I'm being harsh. But hear me out.
The pluses: - the lamb burger was very tasty and they were heavy handed on the feta
The negatives: - it was pricey; $9-10 for the burger, $4 for the fries, plus drink - these are Gott's prices; and we're not in the Ferry Building people, we're in the Western Addition
If I lived in the neighborhood it may get more stars out of me. But I am not entirely sold that it's worth making the trek from Cole Valley.
